Host a zero-waste wedding: Encourage guests to bring their own reusable containers for food and drinks, and avoid single-use plastics by using compostable or biodegradable materials for decorations and serving utensils.
Organize a tree planting ceremony: After the wedding, plant a tree in honor of the couple's love and commitment, which will help to offset the carbon emissions produced during the event.
Have a "green" guestbook: Encourage guests to write messages on recycled paper or fabric instead of signing a traditional guestbook.
Use renewable energy: Consider hiring a solar panel rental company to power the wedding venue, or use wind turbines or geothermal energy to provide electricity.
Create a sustainable wedding dress: Work with a designer who uses eco-friendly fabrics and ethical manufacturing practices to create a unique and beautiful wedding dress.
